title: Hideaki Ozawa
text:
is a Japanese former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> goalkeeper.
Career.
Ozawa was born in <a href="Namegata%2C%20Ibaraki">Namegata</a> on March 17, 1974.
Kashima Antlers.
After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="Kashima%20Antlers">Kashima Antlers</a> in 1992. He could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Masaaki%20Furukawa">Masaaki Furukawa</a> and <a href="Yohei%20Sato">Yohei Sato</a>. In July 1997, he left the club for <a href="spinal%20disc%20herniation">spinal disc herniation</a>.
Yokohama Marinos.
In October 1998, he joined <a href="Yokohama%20F.%20Marinos">Yokohama Marinos</a> (later "Yokohama F. Marinos"). However he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Yoshikatsu%20Kawaguchi">Yoshikatsu Kawaguchi</a>.
Cerezo Osaka (loan).
In 2000, he also played for <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a> on loan from March to August.
Tokyo.
In 2001, he moved to <a href="FC%20Tokyo">FC Tokyo</a>. However he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Yoichi%20Doi">Yoichi Doi</a>.
Kashima Antlers.
In 2004, he returned to Antlers for the first time in 7 years. Although he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Hitoshi%20Sogahata">Hitoshi Sogahata</a>, he played 12 matches in 2006 because Sogahata got hurt.
Sportivo Luqueño.
In January 2010, Sportivo Luqueño's president confirmed Ozawa's signing for the 2010 season, and was confirmed that the club's contact made with foreigners was done through <a href="Jose%20Luis%20Chilavert">Jose Luis Chilavert</a>. When incorporating into the team, Ozawa joined goalkeepers <a href="Mario%20Villasanti">Mario Villasanti</a> and <a href="Ar%C3%ADstides%20Florent%C3%ADn">Arístides Florentín</a>. He also joined <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a> footballer <a href="Georges%20Nouga">Georges Nouga</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ians <a href="Eliel%20Cruz">Eliel Cruz</a> and <a href="Emerson%20Reba">Emerson Reba</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentines</a> <a href="Federico%20Cataruozzolo">Federico Cataruozzolo</a>, <a href="H%C3%A9ctor%20Olmedo">Héctor Olmedo</a>, <a href="Jonathan%20Germano">Jonathan Germano</a>, <a href="Alfredo%20Cano">Alfredo Cano</a> and <a href="Ruben%20Cecco">Ruben Cecco</a>, <a href="Chile">Chile</a>an <a href="Claudio%20Chavarria">Claudio Chavarria</a> and <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>n <a href="Carlos%20Valencia%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201989%29">Carlos Valencia</a> in the team. On 11 November 2010, Ozawa debuted for Sportivo Luqueño in a 1–1 away draw against <a href="Olimpia%20Asunci%C3%B3n">Olimpia Asunción</a>, goalkeeping for 90 minutes. On 21 November 2010, Ozawa goalkeeped for a full game in a 3–1 home victory against <a href="Tacuary">Tacuary</a>. On 28 November 2010, Ozawa goalkeeped the entire game in a 0–0 away draw against <a href="Club%20Sport%20Colombia">Sport Colombia</a>
 On 5 December 2010, Ozawa appeared in his last game for Sportivo Luqueño in a 1–1 home draw against <a href="Club%20Sol%20de%20Am%C3%A9rica">Sol de América</a>. The games disputed were for the 2010 Torneo Clausura.
Albirex Niigata.
In 2011, he returned to Japan and signed with <a href="Albirex%20Niigata">Albirex Niigata</a> in April. From June, he played as regular goalkeeper until end of the season instead <a href="Masaaki%20Higashiguchi">Masaaki Higashiguchi</a> who got hurt. He retired end of 2012 season.
